title: The terrors of sleep paralysis - Ami Angelowicz

title: What's below the tip of the iceberg? - Camille Seaman

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why icebergs are mostly underwater?

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: C
options.text: Because the compression of snow forces air bubbles out of the ice.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are formed from saltwater glaciers.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: D

title: Myths and misconceptions about evolution - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: Who proposed an earlier theory of evolution, suggesting that creatures evolve by developing certain traits over their lifetimes and then passing those on to their offspring?
According to the transcript, how do individual organisms evolve?

options.label: A
options.text: By developing certain traits over their lifetimes and then passing those on to their offspring

multiple-choice.question: What is meant by "evolutionary fitness"?

options.label: A
options.text: The ability of an organism to survive in any environment

options.label: B
options.text: The ability of an organism to reproduce quickly

options.label: C
options.text: How well-suited an organism is to its current environment

options.label: D
options.text: The strength and speed of an organism

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary mechanism by which evolution occurs?
Can a gene that makes an animal altruistically sacrifice itself to help the survival and future reproduction of its siblings or cousins become more widespread?

options.label: A
options.text: No, because the animal dies without reproducing

options.label: B
options.text: Yes, because the gene can still be passed on through relatives

options.label: C
options.text: Only if the animal has already reproduced

options.label: D
options.text: Only if the gene is dominant

multiple-choice.question: What is meant by the phrase "natural selection"?

options.label: A
options.text: A mechanism that selects which genes are best to preserve

options.label: B
options.text: A metaphor for the process by which random genetic mutations cause organisms to behave or develop in different ways

multiple-choice.question: Is there a predetermined plan or ideal form that evolution is progressing towards?

options.label: A
options.text: Yes, evolution is progressing towards an ideal form

options.label: B
options.text: No, evolution proceeds blindly, step by step

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Because our ancestors evolved in an environment where calories were scarce

options.label: C
options.text: Because humans are designed to crave calories

options.label: D
options.text: Because nutrients and vitamins are not important for survival

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a trait that is not ideal, but has developed through evolution?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The human eye's blind spot where the optic nerve exits the retina

options.label: C
options.text: The human brain's ability to learn and adapt

options.label: D
options.text: The human body's ability to heal itself

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of random genetic mutations causing organisms to behave or develop in different ways?

options.label: A
options.text: Some organisms are better suited to their environment and are more likely to reproduce

options.label: B
options.text: Some organisms are less suited to their environment and are less likely to reproduce

options.label: C
options.text: All organisms are equally suited to their environment

options.label: D
options.text: The environment changes to suit the organisms
